title: AI scoring too strict for semantically equivalent translations with minor errors
description:
## Problem
The AI evaluator gives low scores (70%) for translations that are semantically correct but have minor differences like:
- Capitalization ("i" vs "I")
- Minor article mistakes ("a breakfast" vs "breakfast")

Example:
- User: "i had a breakfast with my family"
- Correct: "I had breakfast with my family"  
- Score: 70% Overall (80% Grammar, 60% Word Choice, 70% Naturalness)

While "a breakfast" is technically incorrect English (should be "had breakfast" without article), the meaning is fully preserved and scoring 70% feels punitive for a Vietnamese learner making a common article mistake.

## Expected Behavior
- Capitalization should have minimal impact on score
- Near-equivalent translations should score higher (e.g., 85-90%)
- The 80% threshold to pass becomes very difficult to achieve

## Possible Solutions
1. Add case-insensitive comparison for capitalization issues
2. Adjust AI prompt to be more lenient for article mistakes common to Vietnamese speakers
3. Lower the pass threshold from 80% to 70%
4. Weight different error types differently (capitalization < articles < meaning errors)
close_reason: Fixed: Updated AI prompt to be encouraging, not punitive. Capitalization is now ignored, minor errors like article mistakes only deduct 2-5 points. Translations with correct meaning should score 85-95%.

title: Accuracy indicator shows 0% after submission when translation score is below 80%
description:
## Problem
When a user submits a translation that scores below 80% (the passing threshold), the 'Accuracy' indicator in the top-right corner shows 0% instead of the actual session average accuracy.

## Root Cause
In ParagraphSession.tsx lines 93-106, the session object is only refreshed when the submission passes the threshold (accuracy >= 80%). When accuracy is below 80%, the session state is not updated, so session.averageAccuracy remains at its previous value (0 for new sessions).

## Expected Behavior
The Accuracy indicator should always show the current average accuracy of all submissions in the session, regardless of whether the threshold is passed.

## Reproduction Steps
1. Start a new paragraph session
2. Submit a translation that scores below 80% (e.g., 70%)
3. Observe the Accuracy indicator shows 0% instead of 70%

## Fix
In handleSubmit(), always refresh the session after submission (not just when threshold is passed), OR update the session state locally with the new submission data.
close_reason: Fixed: Session is now always refreshed after submission regardless of threshold

title: Session advances to next sentence even when accuracy < 80%
description:
## Problem
When user submits a translation with accuracy below 80%, the backend still advances currentSentenceIndex. After page refresh, user sees the next sentence instead of staying on the current one to retry.

## Root Cause
In SessionService.java lines 116-117, advanceToNextSentence() is called unconditionally regardless of the accuracy score.

## Expected Behavior
The sentence index should only advance when the user passes the 80% threshold. Below 80%, user must retry the same sentence.

## Fix
Add accuracy check before advancing: only call advanceToNextSentence() when accuracy >= 80.
close_reason: Fixed: Session only advances when accuracy >= 80%
